I have extended "org.eclipse.ui.views" with several new views in my own new 
perspective. 

My views were added as shown below...

<extension
         point="org.eclipse.ui.views">
      <view
            name="Attributes"
            class="com.edsplm.tc.ent.gme.views.attributesview.AttributesView"
            id="com.edsplm.tc.ent.gme.views.attributesview.attributesview">
      </view>

Some of my views are loaded into a folder, therefore some are visible when the 
custom perspective reloads, and some are not. What I found is that the reload

After tracing through with the debugger, what I have found is that, eclipse is 
failing for a custom view that does not have a image specified in the 
plugin.xml and if the view is not visible in the workbench (exists in a folder 
but the other view in the folder is the active one). In the case of the view 
being hidden, the part is never set and WorkbenchPartReference.getTitleImage 
fails to obtain even the default image for this view. If the view is visible, 
there is no problem.

Workaround: 
If I go and add images to each of the views, then there is no problem.
<view
            name="Attributes"
            icon="icons/tree_mode.gif"
            class="com.edsplm.tc.ent.gme.views.attributesview.AttributesView"
            id="com.edsplm.tc.ent.gme.views.attributesview.attributesview">
      </view>
